title.narrative: Reproductive Health Services Training and Education Program 2017-2021
Reproductive Health Services Training and Education Program 2017-2021

description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is to contribute in reduction of Maternal Mortality, morbidity from unsafe abortion and improve the SRHR situation of women and adolescents in the project areas. There are 7 outcomes described in the Project. Outcome-1: Improved Skills of Service providers for SRHR services.; Outcome-2: Improved capacity of the consortium in SRHR program management.. Outcome-3: Increased access to quality SRHR services for women, adolescents and men; Outcome-4: Enhanced knowledge of the women and adolescents in the project areas to make informed choice pertaining to their sexual and reproductive health needs; Outcome-5: Strengthened monitoring, Research, Evaluation and Documentation processes in the consortium. Outcome-6: Strengthened advocacy and social networking initiatives for improving SRHR situation. Outcome-7: Sustainability of the consortium improved. During the entire project period it aims to achieve 152825 MR conducted , 38910 patient managed for complications of unsafe abortion , distribution of 367716 FP methods , 155986 individual received reproductive health education and service at school, community and garments, Institutionalized and sustainable attention at the national level to ensure access to safe abortion and family planning.

Insatsen syftar på att förbättra sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa i Bangladesh och är direkt kopplad till rättighets- och fattigdomsperspektivet. Insatsen ligger också i linje med de prioriteringarna i den svenska resultatstrategin med Bangladesh och inkluderar de fyra principerna om deltagande, icke-diskriminering, öppenhet och ansvarsutkrävande på ett tillfredsställande sätt.
Ambassaden bedömer att insatsen är relevant för svenskt stöd då det inkluderar mänskliga rättigheter och jämställdhet mellan kvinnor och män som är de tematiska prioriteringar för svenskt utvecklingssamarbete. De identifierade indikatorerna bedöms vara realistiska och mätbara. Utbredd korruption, utmaningar kring projektets hållbarhet genom avsaknad av potentiella givare och växande religiösa känslor bedöms som de stora riskerna med programmet.
Som riskreducerande åtgärder måste RHSTEP ta itu med de rekommendationer som identifierats i analysen om kapacitetsbedömning, bl. a. för att minimera de interna riskerna i samband med programmet. För att minska den externa risken kommer RHSTEP att ytterligare förbättra relationen med ministeriet, gemenskapen och andra relevanta intressenter. Dessa kommer att följas upp genom dialog. Programmet kommer att kontinuerligt följas upp av ambassaden. Utfasningen av stödet till RHSTEP från Sverige sker under angiven tidsperiod. Utvärderings sker mid-term.

The purpose of the project is to contribute in reduction of Maternal Mortality, morbidity from unsafe abortion and improve the Sexual Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR) situation of women and adolescents in the Project areas.
This project targets to achieve 152825 MR conducted , 38910 patient managed for Complications of unsafe abortion , distribution of 367716 FP methods , 155986 individual received Reproductive Health service at school, community and garments, Institutionalized and sustainable attention at the national level to ensure access to safe abortion and family planning.
This will be achieved by ensuring that poor and marginalized women and adolescents don't face any financial barrier to access safe MR and modern Family Planning (FP) methods; Providing comprehensive MR and PAC training to health service providers, raising awareness and creation of Demand of SRHR and Supporting Changes in the policy environments for abortion services. SRHR project will help Bangladesh to achieve universal health coverage (SDG 3), by ensuring safe MR services, increasing family planning use and reducing maternal mortality in Bangladesh and creating enabling Environment to exercise sexual reproductive Health and rights.

participating-org.narrative: RHSTEP/Reproductive Health Services Training and Education Program

tag.narrative: 3.1 - By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births.
3.1 - Till 2030 minska mödradödligheten i världen till mindre än 70 dödsfall per 100 000 förlossningar med levande barn.
5.3 - Avskaffa alla skadliga sedvänjor, såsom barnäktenskap, tidiga äktenskap och tvångsäktenskap samt kvinnlig könsstympning.
5.3 - Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Targets related to objective 1 has been met 73% which was 76% in the last year. 293 service providers, community volunteers received training on MR/MRM and other SRHR related issues by the Consortium. The deviation is due to non-participation of the deputed government service providers in MR trainings for private reasons and on replacement was sent. Targets related to objective 2 has been met 144%. Total 214 staffs of consortium received training on different SRHR issues. Safe motherhood related targets were met 126% as clients are now more aware of the service availability. Targets related to objective 3 has been met 124%. Total 26851 MR was conducted. 7911 recieved services related to management of complications of unsafe abortion(PAC). performance of BAPSA has declined significantly. BAPSA has achieved 54% of it's MR related target and 40% of their PAC related target. Target related to objective 4 has been achieved 98% which is related to awareness of Women, men, and adolescents on SRHR issues at the catchment areas. Two exit interviews were conducted, and issue-based research is going on after recruitment of new staff in research. Target concerning Objective 5 which is related to monitoring, staff meetings, visits, audit, exit interview were achieved (117%) during this reporting period. Objective 6 related targets including network meetings, issue-based seminars, national and international day’s observation, workshop; community support group meeting achievement was (80%,). Due to staff’s turnover performance was not achieved to desire level. The achievements against the target is not obtained in several areas. Increasing number of deaths from complications of abortions due to decreased availability of MR services in facilities and increase in the utilization of over the counter provision of medical abortion pills with no counselling, is an area of concern. Measures are required to regulate over the counter sales of medical abortion pills and strengthening counselling during sale. Accreditation of such outlets should be implemented. Concurrently, increasing availability of MR in the facilities should be prioritized.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
